thread.title: Schoolboy airlifted to hospital after being hit by falling tree
thread.title_full: Schoolboy airlifted to hospital after being hit by falling tree

author: Yakub Qureshi
title: Schoolboy airlifted to hospital after being hit by falling tree
text:
News Schoolboy airlifted to hospital after being hit by falling tree The boy, understood to be aged between 14 and 15, was walking to school when he was struck by the 40ft tree as it collapsed on the ground Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A school pupil was airlifted to hospital after being hit by a falling tree in Chorlton . 
The boy, understood to be aged between 14 and 15, was walking to school when he was struck by the 40ft tree as it collapsed on the ground. 
Police were called to the incident in Nell Lane shortly before 8.50am. 
The boy was airlifted to the Manchester Royal Infirmary in an air ambulance as a precaution. 
Police officers attending the incident said the boy suffered cuts and bruises to his arms and legs, but escaped without serious injury. Read More 
The tree, described as at least three storeys tall, blocked Nell Lane until emergency services were able to clear the fallen debris. 
Traffic was being diverted through Southern Cemetery while tree surgeons removed the tree from the road. 
A GMP spokesman said: “The boy had a very lucky escape. It was a very large tree. It missed the rest of his body by just inches. He could have been very seriously hurt. 
“The air ambulance landed nearby and took him to the MRI as a precaution. He had bruises to one of his legs and some scratches.” Read More Man charged with terror offence after suspect package was seized at Manchester Airport 
The drama caused delays for motorists on the morning commute. 
Michael Shaw, 47, from Chorlton, who driving to work, said: “The tree had fallen across the road. It had completely obstructed the road to all traffic. Everyone was having to turn back and find a different way around. 
“I saw a boy being helped to walk by some other school kids. He was limping but he looked okay.” 
Later this morning, Nell Lane was reopened after the tree was removed from the scene. Like us on Facebook
